meanings.definition: The person in charge of a stage crew.
meanings.sent1: The stagehead organized the crew for the play.
meanings.sent2: The stagehead gave instructions to the stage crew.
meanings.sent3: The stagehead made sure the crew had their tasks in order.
meanings.sent4: As the stagehead, she steered the crew towards a successful performance.
meanings.sent5: The stagehead's role was crucial in the smooth running of the show.

meanings.definition: The front part of a stage.
meanings.sent1: The actors stood at the stagehead during the final scene.
meanings.sent2: The spotlight shone brightly on the stagehead of the theater.
meanings.sent3: The kitten playfully explored the stagehead of the platform.
meanings.sent4: The stagehead of the theater was adorned with elegant curtains.
meanings.sent5: The stagehead was where the action unfolded, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: To lead or be in charge of a stage production.
meanings.sent1: She will stagehead the upcoming musical.
meanings.sent2: They chose him to stagehead the school play.
meanings.sent3: He decided to stagehead the drama club's latest production.
meanings.sent4: The director will stagehead the play rehearsals.
meanings.sent5: To stagehead a production requires strong organizational skills.
